intro: Solanum lycopersicum var. piriforme, commonly known as the pear-shaped tomato, is a variant of the domesticated tomato characterized by its unique, elongated, and pear-like fruit shape. This variety typically produces fruits that are slightly flattened and have a more elongated form compared to the standard round tomatoes. Botanically, it belongs to the Solanaceae family and is cultivated for its distinctive appearance and flavor profile. The plant is a herbaceous annual with hairy stems and alternate leaves, typical of the species. It is often grown in gardens for ornamental purposes as well as for its unique fruit.
